Class ApplianceFactoryTest

java.lang.Object
tests.ApplianceFactoryTest
class ApplianceFactoryTest extends Object
Unit tests for the appliance factory classes. These tests validate the creation of various appliances using different factories (EntertainmentFactory, HomeCleaningFactory) and ensure that the correct appliance types are created with the expected properties. The tests also include validation for unknown appliance types to ensure proper exception handling.
Author:
24862664

  • Method Details

    • setUp

      @BeforeEach public void setUp()
      Initialises the test environment before each test. This method creates instances of the EntertainmentFactory and HomeCleaningFactory, which are used to create appliances.

    • testBasicTelevisionCreation

      @Test void testBasicTelevisionCreation()
      Test case for creating a basic television using the EntertainmentFactory. This test ensures that the appliance is correctly created with the expected properties.

    • testLCDTelevisionCreation

      @Test void testLCDTelevisionCreation()
      Test case for creating an LCD television using the EntertainmentFactory. This test ensures that the appliance is correctly created with the expected properties.

    • testBasicWashingMachineCreation

      @Test void testBasicWashingMachineCreation()
      Test case for creating a basic washing machine using the HomeCleaningFactory. This test ensures that the appliance is correctly created with the expected properties.

    • testSuperFastWashingMachineCreation

      @Test void testSuperFastWashingMachineCreation()
      Test case for creating a super fast washing machine using the HomeCleaningFactory. This test ensures that the appliance is correctly created with the expected properties.

    • testUnknownApplianceType

      @Test void testUnknownApplianceType()
      Test case for attempting to create an appliance with an unknown type. This test ensures that the correct exception is thrown when an invalid appliance type is requested.
